intro: Senecio diemii, commonly known as the Cape York senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Senecio diemii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience to dry conditions.
